name: Brawler
description: The brawler chassis excels at closing the distance on the battlefield and dishing out damage up close. It is designed to outlast opponents in close-quarters combat.

primaryAbility.name: Crippling Damage
primaryAbility.description: You score a critical success and deal critical damage on attack rolls of 1 or 2.

secondaryAbility.name: Charging Strike
secondaryAbility.description: As a move action, immediately move to a near enemy and make a melee attack against them. Roll your reactor die.

levelUp: Roll your hit die to gain new hit points. Roll to see if attributes increase, rolling twice for Power and Mobility. At levels 3, 6, and 9, gain a new module.

name: Scout
description: The scout is a light, quick mecha chassis, excelling at concealment and hit-and- run tactics. The scout can use its cloak generator to become hidden even without the use of cover.

primaryAbility.name: Ambush
primaryAbility.description: You have advantage on attacks made while hidden, and deal 1d6 additional damage.

secondaryAbility.name: Cloacking Field
secondaryAbility.description: As a use action, activate your cloaking field and become hidden. Roll your reactor die.

levelUp: Roll your hit die to gain new hit points. Roll to see if attributes increase, rolling twice for Mobility and System. At levels 3, 6, and 9, gain a new module.

name: Striker
description: The striker is a well- rounded, balanced mecha chassis that excels in both combat and utility. Its reactor has the greatest capacity of all four chassis, and it has the unique ability of restoring the reactor energy of its allies.

primaryAbility.name: Adaptable Robotics
primaryAbility.description: When you roll a 20 on a test, you can choose to reroll the die. You must use the new roll.

secondaryAbility.name: Reactor Charge
secondaryAbility.description: As a use action, choose a close mecha. Their reactor die improves by one step, up to its maximum. Roll your reactor die.

levelUp: Roll your hit die to gain new hit points. Roll to see if attributes increase, rolling twice for System and Presence. At levels 3, 6, and 9, gain a new module.

name: Titan
description: The titan is a heavily armored mecha chassis, relying on thick steel and brute force to outlast the enemy. They excel at absorbing damage and protecting their allies.

primaryAbility.name: Kinetic Absorbers
primaryAbility.description: If a close mecha would take damage, you can choose to take that damage instead.

secondaryAbility.name: Energy Shield
secondaryAbility.description: As a use action, choose yourself or another close or near mecha. Roll your reactor die. Once at any point before the start of their next turn, the mecha may roll 1d4 and reduce incoming damage by the result.

levelUp: Roll your hit die to gain new hit points. Roll to see if attributes increase, rolling twice for Presence and Power. At levels 3, 6, and 9, gain a new module.
